page.title: 12GROWING FRUIT AT GORGATE
page.content: The fruit farm includes 150 acres of marshland which have been flooded and converted into reservoirs. The water is used for irrigation and protecting the fruit from frost damage. The whole farm is covered by a system of water sprinklers. When the system was introduced in 1960 it was the first fruit farm in Western Europe to protect blackcurrants from frost by spraying with water. Most of the apples grown are Coxs. The orchards are surrounded by windbreaks made out of alder trees.This helps produce the slightly warmer conditions neede by this variety of apple.
